author: COMSOL
description: Compact camera modules are widely used in electronic devices such as mobile phones and tablet computers. In order to reduce both the size and number of elements required the optical design will typically incorporate several highly aspheric surfaces. This model demonstrates a five element design using the 'Aspheric Even Lens 3D' part from the Ray Optics Module Part Library.
label: compact_camera_module.mph
name: root

settings.description: IR filter to Image Plane distance
settings.name: T_6

settings.description: IR filter to Image Plane distance
settings.name: T_6
commentsinfile
settings.value:
Circular Planar Annulus

Circular planar annulus with negligible thickness.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Aspheric Even Lens 3D

Aspheric lens with either concave or convex surfaces. The surface sag is specified by a conic plus a polynomial defined by the sum of the first 11 even terms. The normalization unit for the aspheric coefficients should be specified. The aspheric surface diameters can be smaller than the outer lens diameter. Clear apertures which are smaller than the surface diameters can be also specified.

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Spherical Lens 3D

Spherical lens with either concave or convex surfaces. The lens surface diameters can be smaller than the outer diameter. Clear apertures which are smaller than the lens surface diameters can be specified.
